results.title: Workman's nightmare

video_links.name: ACMI External Digital Access Copy

results.brief_description:
An early experiment filmed in the Straford backyard in Brighton. It features the acting debut of 14 year-old John - as a workman who tussles with an unruly ladder.
This short work from 1951 marked the boys earliest efforts.

results.title: Essence of Terror
results.brief_description: An inquisitive young boy explores the contents of the medicine cabinet and is tempted into trying the jar labelled ‘Adol Essence’… He is plunged into a world of terror as his body starts to change in alarming new ways.

results.title: How does your garden grow?
results.creator_credit: George Cass, Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Kevin Heinze shows young students various aspects of gardening using simple techniques suitable for the classroom. Topics covered in this 5 part series are: 1) Sowing seeds; 2) Propagating plants; 3) Potting up; 4) Carnivorous plants; 5) Arbor Week.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Cass, Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch and TV Ed Productions

results.title: The Making of Florence - Episode 1

video_links.name: External Digital Access Copy
ACMI External Digital Access Copy

results.brief_description:
Expertly blending the visual novel and gaming genres, Florence illustrates one year in the life of a young woman in Melbourne as she falls in love, breaks her daily routine and follows her creative passion.

Developed by Australian craft games studio Mountains, Florence uses innovative gameplay mechanics to represent social interactions. The emotions of the poignant narrative are rendered through tapping and swiping minigames, making them all the more touching.

In this series of interviews, the developers at Mountains speaks about the studio’s foundation and introduces the staff, describing itself as a ‘craft game studio’. Florence is introduced as a result of this craft, as the studio seeks to create an aesthetically beautiful and moving piece of art, and not simply a game.
